p: T cells are a type of lymphocyte which reside in the lungs and play a key role in protecting against chronic inflammation. Both the regulatory T cells (T-regs) and T helper cells (Th cells) are important defenders in the immune system. Previous research has shown that a large number of anaerobic bacteria originating from the oral cavity are present in the lungs of pulmonary tuberculosis patients, and bacterial metabolites (short-chain fatty acids) were associated with both the oral anaerobic bacterial load (e.g., Prevotella) and T-regs response ( Segal et al., 2017).
